comments:
build 20020517

I have an old copy of RedDotSite on my c: drive, which I had been
using for testing. When I navigate to it in this build, it no
longer appears to have any versions (it is still recognized as a site).
The log shows that there are suspicious internal errors that were
not reported to me.

Expectation: it still has a site.xml describing 2 feature versions.

1) there is a bug in isBroken
2) can you check they are not hidden by the view local popup menu [show matching
features only] ?
3) can you zip up the site and attach it ?

Created an attachment (id=877)
zip of RedDotSite in question

re:(2) - the feature version were indeed being hidden by "show matching
features only"

im is not the first one to be puzzled,
can we have an aknowledgement of the number of found features even if they are 
hidden  ?
Something like n features (m hidden) ?

Rod DOt site has stupid values for os/ws etc. that do not match BootLoader-
approved values. It is correct to show only features that apply to the user's 
platform. The way to see all is to turn the filter off, which is consistent to 
showing hidden files in Packages view.
